New Records: Ben Joyce struck out Tommy Edman on a 105.5 mph fastball, the fastest strikeout pitch ever recorded in the pitch-tracking era, which began in 2008, and the third-fastest pitch overall in that span.
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts' three-run homer capped a four-run 10th inning and helped lift the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 6-2 victory over the Los Angeles Angels.
Shohei Ohtani made sure that the Dodgers wasted little time erasing the deficit, tripling home Miguel Rojas in the top of the third.
Taylor Ward tied the game at 2-all with a solo home run in the fifth.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: There are no post-match reflections mentioned in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani played his first regular-season game at Angel Stadium since leaving the Angels for the Dodgers in the offseason.
The Dodgers (84-55) had only three hits through nine innings before putting together their 10th-inning rally.
Others: Logan O'Hoppe smacked a solo shot in the second to give the Angels a 1-0 lead.
Walker Buehler gave up two runs on five hits in five innings for the Dodgers, walking two and striking out six.
Reid Detmers lasted six innings, allowing two runs and three hits for the Angels, walking two and fanning 10.
